safety_precautions: Always wear safety glasses when using saw or drill

steps.description: Examine the broken chair leg to see if it can be mended or needs to be replaced
If mending is possible, apply wood glue to the broken areas and clamp together. Allow to dry as per glue instructions
If replacement is necessary, remove the broken leg from the chair using the appropriate tool (likely a drill)
Measure and cut the replacement wood to match the size of the original leg
Attach the new leg to the chair using screws and a drill
Sand the repaired or replaced area to prepare it for finishing
Apply wood filler to any gaps or holes, then sand smooth after it dries
Finish or paint the repaired area to match the rest of the chair

tips: Ensure the glue is completely dry before removing clamps
Make sure the replacement leg is the same size and shape as the other legs for stability and aesthetics
Sand with the grain of the wood for the best results
Test the finish/paint on a scrap piece of wood to ensure it matches
